caption.center: STATE of Maine v. Paul THOMPSON.

opinion.posture: Appeal from the Appeal from Superior Court, Lincoln County.
opinion.attorneys:
John R. Atwood, Dist. Atty., David M. Spencer (orally), Asst. Dist. Atty., Wiscasset, for the State.
Andrews B. Campbell (orally), Bowdoinham, for defendant.
opinion.panel: Before McKUSICK, C.J., and NICHOLS, ROBERTS, GLASSMAN, SCOLNIK and CLIFFORD, JJ.Page 1209
opinion.opinion_text:
MEMORANDUM OF DECISION.
From a conviction of driving to endanger, 29 M.R.S.A. ยง 1314 (Supp. 1985), in a jury trial in Superior Court (Lincoln County) the Defendant, Paul Thompson, brings his appeal here, challenging only the sufficiency of the evidence of the incident that occurred September 1, 1984, on the Sawdust Hill Road, Nobleboro, to support that conviction.
We conclude that, viewed in the light most favorable to the prosecution, the trier of fact rationally could find beyond a reasonable doubt every element of the offense charged. State v.Barry, 495 A.2d 825, 826 (Me. 1985).
The entry is:
Judgment affirmed.
Page 257
